9#ifndef V8_WASM_CANONICAL_TYPES_H_
10#define V8_WASM_CANONICAL_TYPES_H_
11
12#include <unordered_map>
13
14#include "src/base/functional.h"
15#include "src/wasm/wasm-module.h"
16
17namespace v8::internal::wasm {
18
19// A singleton class, responsible for isorecursive canonicalization of wasm
20// types.
21// A recursive group is a subsequence of types explicitly marked in the type
22// section of a wasm module. Identical recursive groups have to be canonicalized
23// to a single canonical group. Respective types in two identical groups are
24// considered identical for all purposes.
25// Two groups are considered identical if they have the same shape, and all
26// type indices referenced in the same position in both groups reference:
27// - identical types, if those do not belong to the rec. group,
28// - types in the same relative position in the group, if those belong to the
29// rec. group.
30class TypeCanonicalizer {
31 public:
32 static constexpr uint32_t kPredefinedArrayI8Index = 0;
33 static constexpr uint32_t kPredefinedArrayI16Index = 1;
34 static constexpr uint32_t kNumberOfPredefinedTypes = 2;
35
36 TypeCanonicalizer();
37
38 // Singleton class; no copying or moving allowed.
39 TypeCanonicalizer(const TypeCanonicalizer& other) = delete;
40 TypeCanonicalizer& operator=(const TypeCanonicalizer& other) = delete;
41 TypeCanonicalizer(TypeCanonicalizer&& other) = delete;
42 TypeCanonicalizer& operator=(TypeCanonicalizer&& other) = delete;
43
44 // Registers {size} types of {module} as a recursive group, starting at
45 // {start_index}, and possibly canonicalizes it if an identical one has been
46 // found. Modifies {module->isorecursive_canonical_type_ids}.
47 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void AddRecursiveGroup(WasmModule* module, uint32_t size,
48 uint32_t start_index);
49
50 // Same as above, except it registers the last {size} types in the module.
51 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void AddRecursiveGroup(WasmModule* module, uint32_t size);
52
53 // Same as above, but for a group of size 1 (using the last type in the
54 // module).
55 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void AddRecursiveSingletonGroup(WasmModule* module);
56
57 // Same as above, but receives an explicit start index.
58 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void AddRecursiveSingletonGroup(WasmModule* module,
59 uint32_t start_index);
60
61 // Adds a module-independent signature as a recursive group, and canonicalizes
62 // it if an identical is found. Returns the canonical index of the added
63 // signature.
64 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE uint32_t AddRecursiveGroup(const FunctionSig* sig);
65
66 // Returns if {canonical_sub_index} is a canonical subtype of
67 // {canonical_super_index}.
68 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool IsCanonicalSubtype(uint32_t canonical_sub_index,
69 uint32_t canonical_super_index);
70
71 // Returns if the type at {sub_index} in {sub_module} is a subtype of the
72 // type at {super_index} in {super_module} after canonicalization.
73 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool IsCanonicalSubtype(uint32_t sub_index,
74 uint32_t super_index,
75 const WasmModule* sub_module,
76 const WasmModule* super_module);
77
78 // Deletes recursive groups. Used only by the Wasm compile fuzzer.
79 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void EmptyStorageForTesting();
80
81 size_t EstimateCurrentMemoryConsumption() const;
82
83 private:
84 struct CanonicalType {
85 TypeDefinition type_def;
86 bool is_relative_supertype;
87
88 bool operator==(const CanonicalType& other) const {
89 return type_def == other.type_def &&
90 is_relative_supertype == other.is_relative_supertype;
91 }
92
93 bool operator!=(const CanonicalType& other) const {
94 return !operator==(other);
95 }
96
97 size_t hash_value() const {
98 uint32_t metadata = (type_def.supertype << 2) |
99 (type_def.is_final ? 2 : 0) |
100 (is_relative_supertype ? 1 : 0);
101 base::Hasher hasher;
102 hasher.Add(metadata);
103 if (type_def.kind == TypeDefinition::kFunction) {
104 hasher.Add(*type_def.function_sig);
105 } else if (type_def.kind == TypeDefinition::kStruct) {
106 hasher.Add(*type_def.struct_type);
107 } else {
108 DCHECK_EQ(TypeDefinition::kArray, type_def.kind);
109 hasher.Add(*type_def.array_type);
110 }
111 return hasher.hash();
112 }
113 };
114 struct CanonicalGroup {
115 CanonicalGroup(Zone* zone, size_t size)
116 : types(zone->AllocateVector<CanonicalType>(size)) {}
117
118 bool operator==(const CanonicalGroup& other) const {
119 return types == other.types;
120 }
121
122 bool operator!=(const CanonicalGroup& other) const {
123 return types != other.types;
124 }
125
126 size_t hash_value() const {
127 return base::Hasher{}.AddRange(types.begin(), types.end()).hash();
128 }
129
130 // The storage of this vector is the TypeCanonicalizer's zone_.
131 base::Vector<CanonicalType> types;
132 };
133
134 struct CanonicalSingletonGroup {
135 struct hash {
136 size_t operator()(const CanonicalSingletonGroup& group) const {
137 return group.hash_value();
138 }
139 };
140
141 bool operator==(const CanonicalSingletonGroup& other) const {
142 return type == other.type;
143 }
144
145 size_t hash_value() const { return type.hash_value(); }
146
147 CanonicalType type;
148 };
149
150 void AddPredefinedArrayType(uint32_t index, ValueType element_type);
151
152 int FindCanonicalGroup(const CanonicalGroup&) const;
153 int FindCanonicalGroup(const CanonicalSingletonGroup&) const;
154
155 // Canonicalize all types present in {type} (including supertype) according to
156 // {CanonicalizeValueType}.
157 CanonicalType CanonicalizeTypeDef(const WasmModule* module,
158 TypeDefinition type,
159 uint32_t recursive_group_start);
160
161 // An indexed type gets mapped to a {ValueType::CanonicalWithRelativeIndex}
162 // if its index points inside the new canonical group; otherwise, the index
163 // gets mapped to its canonical representative.
164 ValueType CanonicalizeValueType(const WasmModule* module, ValueType type,
165 uint32_t recursive_group_start) const;
166
167 std::vector<uint32_t> canonical_supertypes_;
168 // Maps groups of size >=2 to the canonical id of the first type.
169 std::unordered_map<CanonicalGroup, uint32_t, base::hash<CanonicalGroup>>
170 canonical_groups_;
171 // Maps group of size 1 to the canonical id of the type.
172 std::unordered_map<CanonicalSingletonGroup, uint32_t,
173 base::hash<CanonicalSingletonGroup>>
174 canonical_singleton_groups_;
175 AccountingAllocator allocator_;
176 Zone zone_{&allocator_, "canonical type zone"};
177 mutable base::Mutex mutex_;
178};
179
180// Returns a reference to the TypeCanonicalizer shared by the entire process.
181V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE TypeCanonicalizer* GetTypeCanonicalizer();
182
183} // namespace v8::internal::wasm
184
185#endif // V8_WASM_CANONICAL_TYPES_H_
